description: From Middle English topsail, topsayl, topseyle, topsaill, equivalent to top +â€Ž sail.

entries.meaning: (nautical) A sail or either of the two sails rigged just above the course sail and supported by the topmast on a square-rigged sailing ship.
(nautical) In a fore-and-aft-rigged sailing boat, the sail that is set above the gaff at the top part of the mast.
